common: Contraindicated; based on data from animal reproduction studies, may cause fetal harm when administered to pregnant females
There are no available data regarding use in pregnant females
Verify pregnancy status in females of reproductive potential before initiating
If patient becomes pregnant during treatment, report drug exposure by calling 1-877-888-4231

description: Administration to pregnant rabbits during organogenesis at ≥4 times the human exposure (total AUC) with the maximum recommended human dose (MRHD) of 10 mg resulted in malformations of the heart and major vessels, as well as increased number of abortions and resorptions

In a prenatal/postnatal toxicity study, oral administration to rats during gestation through lactation caused maternal toxicity, resulting in decreased pup body weight gain (≥10 times the MRHD) and increased pup mortality (24 times the MRHD) during the preweaning period
Advise females of reproductive potential to use effective contraception during treatment and for 1 month after final dose

common: Data are not available on the presence of vericiguat in human milk, effects on breastfed infants, or effects on milk production
Vericiguat is present in the milk of lactating rats and it is likely that vericiguat or its metabolites are present in human milk
Owing to the potential for serious adverse reactions in breastfed infants, advise women not to breastfeed during treatment

description: May cause fetal harm; do not administer to pregnant females
To prevent pregnancy, females of reproductive potential must use effective forms of contraception during treatment and for 1 month after stopping treatment

common: Coadministration with other soluble guanylate cyclase (sGC) stimulators
Based on data from animal reproduction studies, may cause fetal harm when administered to pregnant females and its use is contraindicated

description: Coadministration with other sGC stimulators is contraindicated
Coadministration with PDE-5 inhibitors not recommended owing to potential for hypotension

description.common:
avanafil, vericiguat.
Either increases effects of the other by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Coadministration of vericiguat with PDE-5 inhibitors may result in additive hypotensive effects.

riociguat, vericiguat.
Either increases effects of the other by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Vericiguat is contraindicated with use of other soluble guanylate cyclase (sGC) stimulators.

sildenafil, vericiguat.
Either increases effects of the other by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Coadministration of vericiguat with PDE-5 inhibitors may result in additive hypotensive effects.

tadalafil, vericiguat.
Either increases effects of the other by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Coadministration of vericiguat with PDE-5 inhibitors may result in additive hypotensive effects.

vardenafil, vericiguat.
Either increases effects of the other by pharmacodynamic synergism. Contraindicated. Coadministration of vericiguat with PDE-5 inhibitors may result in additive hypotensive effects.
